criteria: Identification of Major External Body Parts
Identification of Major Internal Body Parts
descriptions: Student cannot identify any major external body parts or provides incorrect names.
Student can identify 1-2 major external body parts with some accuracy.
Student can identify 3-4 major external body parts with reasonable accuracy but may have some difficulty.
Student can identify most major external body parts accurately but may have minor errors.
Student accurately identifies nearly all major external body parts.
Student accurately and comprehensively identifies all major external body parts.
Student cannot identify any major internal body parts or provides incorrect names.
Student can identify 1-2 major internal body parts with some accuracy.
Student can identify 3-4 major internal body parts with reasonable accuracy but may have some difficulty.
Student can identify most major internal body parts accurately but may have minor errors.
Student accurately identifies nearly all major internal body parts.
Student accurately and comprehensively identifies all major internal body parts.
Responses show no understanding of anatomical terminology.
Responses contain significant inaccuracies in anatomical terminology.
Responses show a basic understanding of anatomical terminology, but with several inaccuracies.
Responses are mostly accurate in anatomical terminology, with only minor errors.
Responses are accurate in anatomical terminology with very few errors.
Responses are consistently accurate and demonstrate a thorough understanding of anatomical terminology.
